oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing and Predicting Feedlot Mortality and Culling Using Standard Feedlot Arrival Data
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Babcock, A. H.
Renter, D. G.
White, B. J.
Scott, H. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: feedlots
Economic losses
performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Economic losses due to mortality and out-cattle (any animal that died or was culled prior to harvest) are substantial in commercial feedlots, and the ability to estimate potential losses at arrival would be a valuable tool. Our objectives were to quantify effects of arrival risk factors on cumulative mortality and out-cattle risk and assess the resulting models' performance at predicting these risks in commercial feedlots.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2009; 224
